Hi, 

I've just only started with JUnit, so forgive me if my problems are
i=
rrelevant.

I'm trying to use JUnit4.0 while working with Eclipse 3.1, so I=
 needed
to get acquainted with JUnit4TestAdapter.

What I wanted to achieve=
 was creating several test suites inside a
package that would perform diffe=
rent test methods from one test class.
That's at least how I understood the=
 idea of organising tests :/

I expected to find some methods similar to Te=
stSuite.addTestSuite() in
the JUnit4TestAdapter class, still, the only way =
to create a test
suite with its help that seems to exist is the FAQ-one:

p=
ublic static junit.framework.Test suite() {
        return new junit.framew=
ork.JUnit4TestAdapter(SimpleTest.class);
    }

1. Is it nonsense what I wa=
s trying to achieve?
2. Why is there no documentation on JUnit4TestAdapter =
in JUnit's Javadoc?
3. Can I manually add particular test methods to the Ad=
apter object?
4. Are there any samples showing how to use the @RunWith and
=
@SuiteClasses annottations? (I guess I'm too dumb to get it having
read Jav=
adoc, and google just won't do).

Thanks,

Anna Skawinska
